opentelekomcloud-compute-bms-flavors-v2.body:
data "opentelekomcloud_compute_bms_flavors_v2" "$1" {
    # name - (Optional) - The name of the BMS flavor.
    name = ""

    # id - (Optional) - The BMS flavor id.
    id = ""

    # min_ram - (Optional) - The minimum memory size in MB. Only the BMSs with the memory size greater than or equal to the minimum size can be queried.
    min_ram = ""

    # min_disk - (Optional) - The minimum disk size in GB. Only the BMSs with a disk size greater than or equal to the minimum size can be queried.
    min_disk = ""

    # sort_key - (Optional) - The sorting field. The default value is **flavorid**. The other values are **name**, **memory_mb**, **vcpus**, **root_gb**, or **flavorid**.
    sort_key = ""

    # sort_dir - (Optional) - The sorting order, which can be **ascending** (**asc**) or **descending** (**desc**). The default value is **asc**.
    sort_dir = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "ram" - It is the memory size (in MB) of the flavor.
    # "vcpus" - It is the number of CPU cores in the BMS flavor.
    # "disk" - Specifies the disk size (GB) in the BMS flavor.
    # "swap" -  This is a reserved attribute.
    # "rx_tx_factor" - This is a reserved attribute.
}
opentelekomcloud-compute-bms-flavors-v2.description: `opentelekomcloud_compute_bms_flavors_v2` used to query flavors of BMSs.

opentelekomcloud-compute-bms-keypairs-v2.body:
data "opentelekomcloud_compute_bms_keypairs_v2" "$1" {

}
opentelekomcloud-compute-bms-keypairs-v2.description: `opentelekomcloud_compute_bms_keypairs_v2` used to query SSH key pairs.

opentelekomcloud-compute-bms-nic-v2.body:

    id = ""

    status = ""

    # Exported Attributes

}
opentelekomcloud-compute-bms-nic-v2.description: `opentelekomcloud_compute_bms_nic_v2` used to query information about a BMS NIC based on the NIC ID.

opentelekomcloud-compute-bms-server-v2.body:
data "opentelekomcloud_compute_bms_server_v2" "$1" {
    # id - (Optional) - The unique ID of the BMS.
    id = ""

    # user_id - (Optional) - The ID of the user to which the BMS belongs.
    user_id = ""

    # name - (Optional) - The name of BMS.
    name = ""

    # status - (Optional) - The BMS status.
    status = ""

    # host_status - (Optional) - The nova-compute status: **UP, UNKNOWN, DOWN, MAINTENANCE** and **Null**.
    host_status = ""

    # key_name - (Optional) - It is the SSH key name.
    key_name = ""

    # flavor_id - (Optional) - It gives the BMS flavor information.
    flavor_id = ""

    # image_id - (Optional) - The BMS image.
    image_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "host_id" - 	It is the host ID of the BMS.
    # "progress" - This is a reserved attribute.
    # "metadata" -  The BMS metadata is specified.
    # "access_ip_v4" -  This is a reserved attribute.
    # "access_ip_v6" - This is a reserved attribute.  
    # "addresses" - It gives the BMS network address.
    # "security_groups" - The list of security groups to which the BMS belongs.
    # "tags" - Specifies the BMS tag.
    # "locked" -  It specifies whether a BMS is locked, true: The BMS is locked, false: The BMS is not locked.
    # "config_drive" -  This is a reserved attribute.
    # "availability_zone" - Specifies the AZ ID.
    # "description" -  Provides supplementary information about the pool.
    # "kernel_id" - The UUID of the kernel image when the AMI image is used.
    # "hypervisor_hostname" -  It is the name of a host on the hypervisor.
    # "instance_name" - Instance name is specified.
}
opentelekomcloud-compute-bms-server-v2.description: `opentelekomcloud_compute_bms_server_v2` used to query a BMS or BMSs details.

opentelekomcloud-datasource-antiddos-v1.body:
data "opentelekomcloud_antiddos_v1" "$1" {
    # floating_ip_id - (Optional) The Elastic IP ID.
    floating_ip_id = ""

    # floating_ip_address - (Optional) The Elastic IP address.
    floating_ip_address = ""

    # status - (Optional) The defense status.
    status = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "network_type" - The EIP type.
    # "period_start" - The Start time.
    # "bps_attack" - The Attack traffic in (bit/s).
    # "bps_in" - The inbound traffic in (bit/s).
    # "total_bps" - The total traffic.
    # "pps_in" - The inbound packet rate (number of packets per second).
    # "pps_attack" - The attack packet rate (number of packets per second).
    # "total_pps" - The total packet rate.
    # "start_time" - The start time of cleaning and blackhole event.
    # "end_time" - The end time of cleaning and blackhole event.
    # "traffic_cleaning_status" - The traffic cleaning status.

}
opentelekomcloud-datasource-antiddos-v1.description: The OpenTelekomCloud Antiddos data source allows to query the status of EIP, regardless whether an EIP has been bound to an Elastic Cloud Server (ECS) or not.

opentelekomcloud-datasource-cce-cluster-.body:

    # "description" - Cluster description.

    # "id" - The ID of the cluster.

    # "cluster_version" - The version of cluster in string format.

    # "highway_subnet_id" - The ID of the high speed network used to create bare metal nodes.

    status = ""

    # "availability_zone" - Available partitions where the node is located. 
    # "key_pair" - Key pair name when logging in to select the key pair mode.
    # "billing_mode" - Node's billing mode: The value is 0 (on demand).
    # "charge_mode" - Bandwidth billing type.

    # "eip_ids" - List of existing elastic IP IDs.

    # "share_type" - The bandwidth sharing type.

    # "volumetype" - Disk type.
    # "disk_size" - Disk size in GB.
    # "volumetype" - Disk type.
}
opentelekomcloud-datasource-cce-nodes-v3.description: To get the specified node in a cluster.

    # "parameters" - Specifies the parameters of a backup policy.
    # "name" - Specifies Scheduling period name.
    # "description" - Specifies Scheduling period description.
    # "enabled" - Specifies whether the scheduling period is enabled.
    # "max_backups" - Specifies maximum number of backups that can be automatically created for a backup object.
    # "retention_duration_days" - Specifies duration of retaining a backup, in days.
    # "permanent" - Specifies whether backups are permanently retained.
    # "trigger_pattern" - Specifies Scheduling policy of the scheduler.
    # "operation_type" - Specifies Operation type, which can be backup.

    # "trigger_id" -  Specifies Scheduler ID.
    # "trigger_name" -  Specifies Scheduler name.
    # "trigger_type" -  Specifies Scheduler type.
    # "trigger_type" -  Specifies Scheduler type.
    # "id" - Specifies the ID of the object to be backed up.
    # "type" - Entity object type of the backup object. 
    # "name" - Specifies backup object name.
    # "name" - Specifies backup object name.
    # "key" - Tag key. It cannot be an empty string.
    # "value" - Tag value. It can be an empty string.
    # "value" - Tag value. It can be an empty string.
}
opentelekomcloud-datasource-csbs-backup-.description: The OpenTelekomCloud CSBS Backup Policy data source allows access of backup Policy resources.

opentelekomcloud-datasource-kms-data-key.body:
data "opentelekomcloud_kms_data_key_v1" "$1" {
    # datakey_length - (Required) Number of bits in the length of a DEK (data encryption keys).   The maximum number is 512. Changing this gets the new data encryption key.
    datakey_length = ""

    # key_id - (Required) The globally unique identifier for the key.   Changing this gets the new data encryption key.
    key_id = ""

    # encryption_context - (Optional) The value of this parameter must be a series of   "key:value" pairs used to record resource context information. The value of this   parameter must not contain sensitive information and must be within 8192 characters   in length. Example: {"Key1":"Value1","Key2":"Value2"}
    encryption_context = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" is set to the date of the found data key. In addition, the following attributes
are exported:
    # "plain_text" - The plaintext of a DEK is expressed in hexadecimal format, and two
    # "datakey_length" - (Required) Number of bits in the length of a DEK (data encryption keys).   The maximum number is 512. Changing this gets the new data encryption key.
    # "cipher_text" - The ciphertext of a DEK is expressed in hexadecimal format, and two
    # "datakey_length" - (Required) Number of bits in the length of a DEK (data encryption keys).   The maximum number is 512. Changing this gets the new data encryption key.
}
opentelekomcloud-datasource-kms-data-key.description:
Use this data source to get the plaintext and the ciphertext of an available
OpenTelekomCloud KMS DEK (data encryption key).

opentelekomcloud-datasource-kms-key-v1.body:
data "opentelekomcloud_kms_key_v1" "$1" {
    # key_alias - (Optional) The alias in which to create the key. It is required when   we create a new key. Changing this gets the new key.
    key_alias = ""

    # key_description - (Optional) The description of the key as viewed in OpenTelekomCloud console.   Changing this gets a new key.
    key_description = ""

    # realm - (Optional) Region where a key resides. Changing this gets a new key.
    realm = ""

    # key_id - (Optional) The globally unique identifier for the key. Changing this gets the new key.
    key_id = ""

    # default_key_flag - (Optional) Identification of a Master Key. The value "1" indicates a Default   Master Key, and the value "0" indicates a key. Changing this gets a new key.
    default_key_flag = ""

    # key_state - (Optional) The state of a key. "1" indicates that the key is waiting to be activated.   "2" indicates that the key is enabled. "3" indicates that the key is disabled. "4" indicates that   the key is scheduled for deletion. Changing this gets a new key.
    key_state = ""

    # domain_id - (Optional)  - ID of a user domain for the key. Changing this gets a new key.
    domain_id = ""

    # origin - (Optional) Origin of a key. such as: kms. Changing this gets a new key.
    origin = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" is set to the ID of the found key. In addition, the following attributes
are exported:
    # "key_alias" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "origin" - Origin of a key. such as: kms. Changing this gets a new key.
    # "key_description" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "origin" - Origin of a key. such as: kms. Changing this gets a new key.
    # "realm" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "origin" - Origin of a key. such as: kms. Changing this gets a new key.
    # "key_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "origin" - Origin of a key. such as: kms. Changing this gets a new key.
    # "default_key_flag" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "origin" - Origin of a key. such as: kms. Changing this gets a new key.
    # "origin" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "origin" - Origin of a key. such as: kms. Changing this gets a new key.
    # "scheduled_deletion_date" - Scheduled deletion time (time stamp) of a key.
    # "origin" - Origin of a key. such as: kms. Changing this gets a new key.
    # "domain_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "origin" - Origin of a key. such as: kms. Changing this gets a new key.
    # "expiration_time" - Expiration time.
    # "origin" - Origin of a key. such as: kms. Changing this gets a new key.
    # "creation_date" - Creation time (time stamp) of a key.
    # "origin" - Origin of a key. such as: kms. Changing this gets a new key.
    # "key_state" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "origin" - Origin of a key. such as: kms. Changing this gets a new key.
}
opentelekomcloud-datasource-kms-key-v1.description: Use this data source to get the ID of an available OpenTelekomCloud KMS key.

opentelekomcloud-datasource-networking-n.body:
data "opentelekomcloud_networking_network_v2" "$1" {
    # region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Neutron client. A Neutron client is needed to retrieve networks ids. If omitted, the `region` argument of the provider is used.
    region = ""

    # network_id - (Optional) The ID of the network.
    network_id = ""

    # name - (Optional) The name of the network.
    name = ""

    # matching_subnet_cidr - (Optional) The CIDR of a subnet within the network.
    matching_subnet_cidr = ""

    # tenant_id - (Optional) The owner of the network.
    tenant_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" is set to the ID of the found network. In addition, the following attributes
are exported:
    # "admin_state_up" - (Optional) The administrative state of the network.
    # "tenant_id" - (Optional) The owner of the network.
    # "name" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "tenant_id" - (Optional) The owner of the network.
    # "region" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "tenant_id" - (Optional) The owner of the network.
    # "shared" - (Optional)  Specifies whether the network resource can be accessed
    # "tenant_id" - (Optional) The owner of the network.
}
opentelekomcloud-datasource-networking-n.description: Use this data source to get the ID of an available OpenTelekomCloud network.

opentelekomcloud-datasource-networking-s.body:
data "opentelekomcloud_networking_secgroup_v2" "$1" {
    # region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Neutron client. A Neutron client is needed to retrieve security groups ids. If omitted, the `region` argument of the provider is used.
    region = ""

    # secgroup_id - (Optional) The ID of the security group.
    secgroup_id = ""

    # name - (Optional) The name of the security group.
    name = ""

    # tenant_id - (Optional) The owner of the security group.
    tenant_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" is set to the ID of the found security group. In addition, the following
attributes are exported:
    # "name" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "tenant_id" - (Optional) The owner of the security group.
    # "description"- The description of the security group.
    # "tenant_id" - (Optional) The owner of the security group.
    # "region" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "tenant_id" - (Optional) The owner of the security group.
}
opentelekomcloud-datasource-networking-s.description: Use this data source to get the ID of an available OpenTelekomCloud security group.

opentelekomcloud-datasource-rds-flavors-.body:

are exported:

    # "datastore_name" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "speccode" - (Optional) The spec code of a rds flavor.
    # "datastore_version" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "speccode" - (Optional) The spec code of a rds flavor.
    # "speccode" - See Argument Reference above.

opentelekomcloud-datasource-rts-software.body:
data "opentelekomcloud_rts_software_config_v1" "$1" {
    # id - (Optional) The id of the software configuration.

opentelekomcloud-datasource-rts-software.body:
data "opentelekomcloud_rts_software_deployment_v1" "$1" {

}
opentelekomcloud-datasource-rts-software.description: The RTS Software Deployment data source provides details about a specific RTS Software Deployment.

opentelekomcloud-datasource-rts-stack-re.body:
data "opentelekomcloud_rts_stack_resource_v1" "$1" {
    # stack_name - (Required) The unique stack name.
    stack_name = ""

    # resource_name - (Optional) The name of a resource in the stack.
    resource_name = ""

    # physical_resource_id - (Optional) The physical resource ID.
    physical_resource_id = ""

    # resource_type - (Optional) The resource type.
    resource_type = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "logical_resource_id" - The logical resource ID.

    # "resource_status_reason" - The resource operation reason.
    # "required_by" - Specifies the resource dependency.
}
opentelekomcloud-datasource-rts-stack-re.description: The OpenTelekomCloud RTS Stack Resource data source allows access to stack resource metadata.

opentelekomcloud-datasource-rts-stack-v1.body:
data "opentelekomcloud_rts_stack_v1" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) The name of the stack.
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - A unique identifier of the stack.
    # "capabilities" - List of stack capabilities for stack.
    # "notification_topics" - List of notification topics for stack.
    # "status" - Specifies the stack status.
    # "disable_rollback" - Whether the rollback of the stack is disabled when stack creation fails.
    # "outputs" - A list of stack outputs.
    # "parameters" - A map of parameters that specify input parameters for the stack.
    # "template_body" - Structure containing the template body.
    # "timeout_mins" - Specifies the timeout duration.
}
opentelekomcloud-datasource-rts-stack-v1.description: The OpenTelekomCloud RTS Stack data source allows access to stack outputs and other useful data including the template body.

opentelekomcloud-datasource-s3-bucket-ob.body:
data "opentelekomcloud_s3_bucket_object" "$1" {
    # key - (Required) The full path to the object inside the bucket
    key = ""

    # bucket - (Required) The name of the bucket to read the object from
    bucket = ""

    # version_id - (Optional) Specific version ID of the object returned (defaults to latest version)
    version_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "body" - Object data (see **limitations above** to understand cases in which this field is actually available)
    # "cache_control" - Specifies caching behavior along the request/reply chain.
    # "content_disposition" - Specifies presentational information for the object.
    # "content_encoding" - Specifies what content encodings have been applied to the object and thus what decoding mechanisms must be applied to obtain the media-type referenced by the Content-Type header field.
    # "content_language" - The language the content is in.
    # "content_length" - Size of the body in bytes.
    # "content_type" - A standard MIME type describing the format of the object data.
    # "etag" - [ETag](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTP_ETag) generated for the object (an MD5 sum of the object content in case it's not encrypted)
    # "expiration" - If the object expiration is configured (see [object lifecycle management](http://docs.opentelekomcloud.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/object-lifecycle-mgmt.html)), the field includes this header. It includes the expiry-date and rule-id key value pairs providing object expiration information. The value of the rule-id is URL encoded.
    # "expires" - The date and time at which the object is no longer cacheable.
    # "last_modified" - Last modified date of the object in RFC1123 format (e.g. "Mon, 02 Jan 2006 15:04:05 MST")
    # "metadata" - A map of metadata stored with the object in S3
    # "server_side_encryption" - If the object is stored using server-side encryption (KMS or Amazon S3-managed encryption key), this field includes the chosen encryption and algorithm used.
    # "sse_kms_key_id" - If present, specifies the ID of the Key Management Service (KMS) master encryption key that was used for the object.
    # "storage_class" - [Storage class](http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/storage-class-intro.html) information of the object. Available for all objects except for "Standard" storage class objects.
    # "version_id" - The latest version ID of the object returned.
    # "website_redirect_location" - If the bucket is configured as a website, redirects requests for this object to another object in the same bucket or to an external URL. Amazon S3 stores the value of this header in the object metadata.
    # "tags"  - A mapping of tags assigned to the object.
}
opentelekomcloud-datasource-s3-bucket-ob.description:
The S3 object data source allows access to the metadata and
_optionally_ (see below) content of an object stored inside S3 bucket. ~> **Note:** The content of an object (`body` field) is available only for objects which have a human-readable `Content-Type` (`text/*` and `application/json`). This is to prevent printing unsafe characters and potentially downloading large amount of data which would be thrown away in favour of metadata.

opentelekomcloud-datasource-sfs-file-sys.body:
data "opentelekomcloud_sfs_file_system_v2" "$1" {
    # name - (Optional) The name of the shared file system.
    name = ""

    # id - (Optional) The UUID of the shared file system.
    id = ""

    # status - (Optional) The status of the shared file system.
    status = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "availability_zone" - The availability zone name.
    # "size" - 	The size (GB) of the shared file system.
    # "share_type" - The storage service type for the shared file system, such as high-performance storage (composed of SSDs) or large-capacity storage (composed of SATA disks).
    # "status" - The status of the shared file system.
    # "host" - The host name of the shared file system.
    # "is_public" - The level of visibility for the shared file system.
    # "share_proto" - The protocol for sharing file systems.
    # "volume_type" - The volume type.
    # "metadata" - Metadata key and value pairs as a dictionary of strings.
    # "export_location" - The path for accessing the shared file system.
    # "access_level" - The level of the access rule.
    # "access_rules_status" - The status of the share access rule.
    # "access_type" - The type of the share access rule.
    # "access_to" - The access that the back end grants or denies.
    # "share_access_id" - The UUID of the share access rule.
    # "mount_id" - The UUID of the mount location of the shared file system.
    # "share_instance_id" - The access that the back end grants or denies.
    # "preferred" - Identifies which mount locations are most efficient and are used preferentially when multiple mount locations exist.
}
opentelekomcloud-datasource-sfs-file-sys.description: Provides information about an Shared File System (SFS).

opentelekomcloud-datasource-subnet-ids-v.description: `opentelekomcloud_vpc_subnet_ids_v1` provides a list of subnet ids for a vpc_id This resource can be useful for getting back a list of subnet ids for a vpc.

opentelekomcloud-datasource-vbs-backup-p.body:
data "opentelekomcloud_vbs_backup_policy_v2" "$1" {
    # values - (Required) Specifies the List of tag values. This list can have a maximum of 10 values and all be unique.
    values = ""

    # key - (Required) Specifies the tag key. Tag keys must be unique.
    key = ""

    # id - (Optional) - The ID of the specific VBS backup policy to retrieve.
    id = ""

    # name - (Optional) - The name of the specific VBS backup policy to retrieve.
    name = ""

    # status - (Optional) - The status of the specific VBS backup policy to retrieve. The values can be ON or OFF
    status = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "name" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "status" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "start_time" - Specifies the start time of the backup job.The value is in the HH:mm format.                                                         
    # "retain_first_backup" - Specifies whether to retain the first backup in the current month. 
    # "rentention_num" - Specifies number of retained backups.
    # "frequency" - Specifies the backup interval. The value is in the range of 1 to 14 days.
    # "policy_resource_count" - Specifies the number of volumes associated with the backup policy.
    # "key" - Specifies the tag key. 
    # "value" - Specifies the tag value. 
}
opentelekomcloud-datasource-vbs-backup-p.description: The VBS Backup Policy data source provides details about a specific VBS backup policy.

opentelekomcloud-datasource-vbs-backup-s.description: VBS Backup Share can be imported using the `backup id`, e.g.  $ terraform import opentelekomcloud_vbs_backup_share_v2.backupshare 4779ab1c-7c1a-44b1-a02e-93dfc361b32d

opentelekomcloud-datasource-vbs-backup-v.description: VBS Backup can be imported using the `backup id`, e.g.  $ terraform import opentelekomcloud_vbs_backup_v2.mybackup 4779ab1c-7c1a-44b1-a02e-93dfc361b32d

opentelekomcloud-datasource-vpc-peering-.body:
data "opentelekomcloud_vpc_peering_connection_v2" "$1" {

opentelekomcloud-datasource-vpc-peering-.description: The VPC Peering Connection data source provides details about a specific VPC peering connection.

opentelekomcloud-datasource-vpc-route-id.description: `opentelekomcloud_vpc_route_ids_v2` provides a list of route ids for a vpc_id. This resource can be useful for getting back a list of route ids for a vpc.

opentelekomcloud-datasource-vpc-route-v2.body:
data "opentelekomcloud_vpc_route_v2" "$1" {
    # id - (Optional) - The id of the specific route to retrieve.
    id = ""

    # vpc_id - (Optional) - The id of the VPC that the desired route belongs to.
    vpc_id = ""

    # destination - (Optional) - The route destination address (CIDR).
    destination = ""

    # tenant_id - (Optional) - Only the administrator can specify the tenant ID of other tenants.
    tenant_id = ""

    # type - (Optional) - Route type for filtering.
    type = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
opentelekomcloud-datasource-vpc-route-v2.description: `opentelekomcloud_vpc_route_v2` provides details about a specific VPC route.

opentelekomcloud-datasource-vpc-subnet-v.body:
data "opentelekomcloud_vpc_subnet_v1" "$1" {
    # id - (Optional) - Specifies a resource ID in UUID format.
    id = ""

    # name - (Optional) - The name of the specific subnet to retrieve.
    name = ""

    # cidr - (Optional) - The network segment of specific subnet to retrieve. The value must be in CIDR format.
    cidr = ""

    # status - (Optional) - The value can be ACTIVE, DOWN, UNKNOWN, or ERROR.
    status = ""

    # vpc_id - (Optional) - The id of the VPC that the desired subnet belongs to.
    vpc_id = ""

    # gateway_ip - (Optional) - The subnet gateway address of specific subnet.
    gateway_ip = ""

    # primary_dns - (Optional) - The IP address of DNS server 1 on the specific subnet.
    primary_dns = ""

    # secondary_dns - (Optional) - The IP address of DNS server 2 on the specific subnet.
    secondary_dns = ""

    # availability_zone - (Optional) - The availability zone (AZ) to which the subnet should belong.
    availability_zone = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
opentelekomcloud-datasource-vpc-subnet-v.description:
`opentelekomcloud_vpc_subnet_v1` provides details about a specific VPC subnet. This resource can prove useful when a module accepts a subnet id as
an input variable and needs to, for example, determine the id of the
VPC that the subnet belongs to.

opentelekomcloud-datasource-vpc-v1.body:
data "opentelekomcloud_vpc_v1" "$1" {
    # region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V1 VPC client. A VPC client is needed to retrieve VPCs. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used.
    region = ""

    # id - (Optional) The id of the specific VPC to retrieve.
    id = ""

    # status - (Optional) The current status of the desired VPC. Can be either CREATING, OK, DOWN, PENDING_UPDATE, PENDING_DELETE, or ERROR.
    status = ""

    # name - (Optional) A unique name for the VPC. The name must be unique for a tenant. The value is a string of no more than 64 characters and can contain digits, letters, underscores (_), and hyphens (-).
    name = ""

    # cidr - (Optional) The cidr block of the desired VPC.
    cidr = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - ID of the VPC.
    # "name" -  See Argument Reference above.
    # "status" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "cidr" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "routes" - The list of route information with destination and nexthop fields.
    # "shared" - Specifies whether the cross-tenant sharing is supported.
    # "region" - See Argument Reference above.
}
opentelekomcloud-datasource-vpc-v1.description: opentelekomcloud_vpc_v1 provides details about a specific VPC. This resource can prove useful when a module accepts a vpc id as an input variable and needs to, for example, determine the CIDR block of that VPC.

opentelekomcloud-resource-antiddos-v1.body:
resource "opentelekomcloud_antiddos_v1" "$1" {
    # floating_ip_id - (Required) The ID corresponding to the Elastic IP Address (EIP) of a user.
    floating_ip_id = ""

    # app_type_id - (Required) The application type ID. 
    app_type_id = ""

    # cleaning_access_pos_id - (Required) 
    cleaning_access_pos_id = ""

    # http_request_pos_id - (Required) The position ID of number of HTTP requests. The value ranges from 1 to 15.
    http_request_pos_id = ""

    # traffic_pos_id - (Required) The position ID of traffic. The value ranges from 1 to 9.
    traffic_pos_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
opentelekomcloud-resource-antiddos-v1.description: Anti-DDoS monitors the service traffic from the Internet to ECSs, ELB instances, and BMSs to detect attack traffic in real time. It then cleans attack traffic according to user-configured defense policies so that services run as normal.

opentelekomcloud-resource-as-configurati.body:
resource "opentelekomcloud_as_configuration_v1" "$1" {
    # charging_mode - (Required) The bandwidth charging mode. The system only supports `traffic`.
    charging_mode = ""

    # share_type - (Required) The bandwidth sharing type. The system only supports `PER` (indicates exclusive bandwidth).
    share_type = ""

    # size - (Required) The bandwidth (Mbit/s). The value range is 1 to 300.
    size = ""

    # bandwidth - (Required) The bandwidth information. The structure is described below.
    bandwidth = ""

    # ip_type - (Required) The IP address type. The system only supports `5_bgp` (indicates dynamic BGP).
    ip_type = ""

    # contents - (Required) The content of the injected file, which must be encoded with base64.
    contents = ""

    # eip - (Required) The configuration parameter for creating an elastic IP address
    eip = ""

    # contents - (Required) The content of the injected file, which must be encoded with base64.
    contents = ""

    # path - (Required) The absolute path of the destination file.
    path = ""

    # disk_type - (Required) Whether the disk is a system disk or a data disk. Option `DATA` indicates   a data disk. option `SYS` indicates a system disk.
    disk_type = ""

    # volume_type - (Required) The disk type, which must be the same as the disk type available in the system.   The options include `SATA` (common I/O disk type) and `SSD` (ultra-high I/O disk type).
    volume_type = ""

    # size - (Required) The disk size. The unit is GB. The system disk size ranges from 40 to 32768,   and the data disk size ranges from 10 to 32768.
    size = ""

    # key_name - (Required) The name of the SSH key pair used to log in to the instance.
    key_name = ""

    # instance_config - (Required) The information about instance configurations. The instance_config   dictionary data structure is documented below.
    instance_config = ""

opentelekomcloud-resource-blockstorage-v.body:
resource "opentelekomcloud_blockstorage_volume_attach_v2" "$1" {
    # volume_id - (Required) The ID of the Volume to attach to an Instance.
    volume_id = ""

    # host_name - (Required) The host to attach the volume to.
    host_name = ""

    # region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Block Storage   client. A Block Storage client is needed to create a volume attachment.   If omitted, the `region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this   creates a new volume attachment.
    region = ""

    # attach_mode - (Optional) Specify whether to attach the volume as Read-Only (`ro`) or Read-Write (`rw`). Only values of `ro` and `rw` are accepted. If left unspecified, the Block Storage API will apply a default of `rw`.
    attach_mode = ""

    # device - (Optional) The device to tell the Block Storage service this volume will be attached as. This is purely for informational purposes. You can specify `auto` or a device such as `/dev/vdc`.
    device = ""

    # initiator - (Optional) The iSCSI initiator string to make the connection.
    initiator = ""

    # ip_address - (Optional) The IP address of the `host_name` above.
    ip_address = ""

    # multipath - (Optional) Whether to connect to this volume via multipath.
    multipath = ""

    # os_type - (Optional) The iSCSI initiator OS type.
    os_type = ""

    # platform - (Optional) The iSCSI initiator platform.
    platform = ""

    # wwpn - (Optional) An array of wwpn strings. Used for Fibre Channel connections.
    wwpn = ""

    # wwnn - (Optional) A wwnn name. Used for Fibre Channel connections.
    wwnn = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "data" - This is a map of key/value pairs that contain the connection information. You will want to pass this information to a provisioner script to finalize the connection. See below for more information.
    # "driver_volume_type" - The storage driver that the volume is based on.
    # "mount_point_base" - A mount point base name for shared storage.
}
opentelekomcloud-resource-blockstorage-v.description:
This resource is experimental and may be removed in the future! Feedback
is requested if you find this resource useful or if you find any problems
with it. Creates a general purpose attachment connection to a Block
Storage volume using the OpenTelekomCloud Block Storage (Cinder) v2 API.
Depending on your Block Storage service configuration, this
resource can assist in attaching a volume to a non-OpenTelekomCloud resource
such as a bare-metal server or a remote virtual machine in a
different cloud provider. This does not actually attach a volume to an instance. Please use
the `opentelekomcloud_compute_volume_attach_v2` resource for that.

opentelekomcloud-resource-ces-alarmrule.body:
resource "opentelekomcloud_ces-alarmrule" "$1" {
    # notification_list - (Required) specifies the topic urn list of the target   notification objects. the maximum length is 5. the topic urn list can be   obtained from simple message notification (smn) and in the following format:   urn: smn:([a-z]|[a-z]|[0-9]|\-){1,32}:([a-z]|[a-z]|[0-9]){32}:([a-z]|[a-z]|[0-9]|\-|\_){1,256}.   if type is set to notification, the value of notification_list cannot be   empty. if type is set to autoscaling, the value of notification_list must   be [] and the value of namespace must be sys.as.   Note: to enable the as alarm rules take effect, you must bind scaling   policies. for details, see the auto scaling api reference.
    notification_list = ""

    # count - (Required) Specifies the number of consecutive occurrence times.   The value ranges from 1 to 5.
    count = ""

    # value - (Required) Specifies the alarm threshold. The value ranges from   0 to Number of 1.7976931348623157e+308.
    value = ""

    # comparison_operator - (Required) Specifies the comparison condition of alarm   thresholds. The value can be >, =, <, >=, or <=.
    comparison_operator = ""

    # filter - (Required) Specifies the data rollup methods. The value can be   max, min, average, sum, and vaiance.
    filter = ""

    # period - (Required) Specifies the alarm checking period in seconds. The   value can be 1, 300, 1200, 3600, 14400, and 86400.   Note: If period is set to 1, the raw metric data is used to determine   whether to generate an alarm.
    period = ""

    value = ""

    dimensions = ""

    metric_name = ""

    namespace = ""

    # condition - (Required) Specifies the alarm triggering condition. The structure   is described below.
    condition = ""

    # metric - (Required) Specifies the alarm metrics. The structure is described   below.
    metric = ""

    # alarm_name - (Required) Specifies the name of an alarm rule. The value can   be a string of 1 to 128 characters that can consist of numbers, lowercase letters,   uppercase letters, underscores (_), or hyphens (-).
    alarm_name = ""

    # alarm_description - (Optional) The value can be a string of 0 to 256 characters.
    alarm_description = ""

    # alarm_actions - (Optional) Specifies the action triggered by an alarm. The   structure is described below.
    alarm_actions = ""

    # insufficientdata_actions - (Optional) Specifies the action triggered by   data insufficiency. The structure is described below.
    insufficientdata_actions = ""

    # ok_actions - (Optional) Specifies the action triggered by the clearing of   an alarm. The structure is described below.
    ok_actions = ""

    # alarm_enabled - (Optional) Specifies whether to enable the alarm. The default   value is true.
    alarm_enabled = ""

    # alarm_action_enabled - (Optional) Specifies whether to enable the action   to be triggered by an alarm. The default value is true.   Note: If alarm_action_enabled is set to true, at least one of the following   parameters alarm_actions, insufficientdata_actions, and ok_actions cannot   be empty. If alarm_actions, insufficientdata_actions, and ok_actions coexist,   their corresponding notification_list must be of the same value.
    alarm_action_enabled = ""

    # unit - (Optional) Specifies the data unit.
    unit = ""

    # type - (Optional) specifies the type of action triggered by an alarm. the   value can be notification or autoscaling.   notification: indicates that a notification will be sent to the user.   autoscaling: indicates that a scaling action will be triggered.
    type = ""

    # type - (Optional) specifies the type of action triggered by an alarm. the   value is notification.   notification: indicates that a notification will be sent to the user.
    type = ""

    # notification_list - (Optional) indicates the list of objects to be notified   if the alarm status changes. the maximum length is 5.
    notification_list = ""

    # type - (Optional) specifies the type of action triggered by an alarm. the   value is notification.   notification: indicates that a notification will be sent to the user.
    type = ""

    # notification_list - (Optional) indicates the list of objects to be notified   if the alarm status changes. the maximum length is 5.
    notification_list = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "alarm_name" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "notification_list" - (Optional) indicates the list of objects to be notified   if the alarm status changes. the maximum length is 5.
    # "alarm_description" - See Argument Reference above.

    # "metric" - See Argument Reference above.

    # "insufficientdata_actions" - See Argument Reference above.

    # "update_time" - Specifies the time when the alarm status changed. The value

    # "alarm_state" - Specifies the alarm status. The value can be:

opentelekomcloud-resource-compute-bms-se.body:
resource "opentelekomcloud_compute_bms_server_v2" "$1" {
    # availability_zone - (Required) The availability zone in which to create   the bms server.
    availability_zone = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the BMS.
    name = ""

    # region - (Optional) The region in which to create the bms server instance. If   omitted, the `region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this   creates a new bms server.
    region = ""

    # image_id - (Optional) (Optional; Required if `image_name` is empty.) Changing this creates a new bms server.
    image_id = ""

    # image_name - (Optional) (Optional; Required if `image_id` is empty.) The name of the   desired image for the bms server. Changing this creates a new bms server.
    image_name = ""

    # flavor_id - (Optional) (Optional; Required if `flavor_name` is empty) The flavor ID of   the desired flavor for the bms server. Changing this resizes the existing bms server.
    flavor_id = ""

    # flavor_name - (Optional) (Optional; Required if `flavor_id` is empty) The name of the   desired flavor for the bms server. Changing this resizes the existing bms server.
    flavor_name = ""

    # user_data - (Optional) The user data to provide when launching the instance.   Changing this creates a new bms server.
    user_data = ""

    # security_groups - (Optional) An array of one or more security group names   to associate with the bms server. Changing this results in adding/removing   security groups from the existing bms server.
    security_groups = ""

    # network - (Optional) An array of one or more networks to attach to the   bms instance. Changing this creates a new bms server.
    network = ""

    # metadata - (Optional) Metadata key/value pairs to make available from   within the instance. Changing this updates the existing bms server metadata.
    metadata = ""

    # admin_pass - (Optional) The administrative password to assign to the bms server.   Changing this changes the root password on the existing server.
    admin_pass = ""

    # key_pair - (Optional) The name of a key pair to put on the bms server. The key   pair must already be created and associated with the tenant's account.   Changing this creates a new bms server.
    key_pair = ""

    # stop_before_destroy - (Optional) Whether to try stop instance gracefully   before destroying it, thus giving chance for guest OS daemons to stop correctly.   If instance doesn't stop within timeout, it will be destroyed anyway.
    stop_before_destroy = ""

    # uuid - (Optional) (Required unless `port`  or `name` is provided) The network UUID to   attach to the bms server. Changing this creates a new bms server.
    uuid = ""

    # name - (Optional) (Required unless `uuid` or `port` is provided) The human-readable   name of the network. Changing this creates a new bms server.
    name = ""

    # port - (Optional) (Required unless `uuid` or `name` is provided) The port UUID of a   network to attach to the bms server. Changing this creates a new server.
    port = ""

    # access_network - (Optional) Specifies if this network should be used for   provisioning access. Accepts true or false. Defaults to false.
    access_network = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
opentelekomcloud-resource-compute-bms-se.description: In addition to all arguments above, the following attributes are exported: `id` - The id of the bms server. `config_drive` - Whether to use the config_drive feature to configure the instance. `kernel_id` - The UUID of the kernel image when the AMI image is used. `user_id` - The ID of the user to which the BMS belongs. `host_status` - The nova-compute status: **UP, UNKNOWN, DOWN, MAINTENANCE** and **Null**.

opentelekomcloud-resource-compute-floati.description:
Associate a floating IP to an instance. This can be used instead of the
`floating_ip` options in `opentelekomcloud_compute_instance_v2`.

opentelekomcloud-resource-compute-floati.body:
resource "opentelekomcloud_compute_floatingip_v2" "$1" {
    # pool - (Required) The name of the pool from which to obtain the floating   IP. Changing this creates a new floating IP.
    pool = ""

    # region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Compute client.   A Compute client is needed to create a floating IP that can be used with   a compute instance. If omitted, the `region` argument of the provider   is used. Changing this creates a new floating IP (which may or may not   have a different address).
    region = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "region" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "pool" - (Required) The name of the pool from which to obtain the floating   IP. Changing this creates a new floating IP.
    # "pool" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "pool" - (Required) The name of the pool from which to obtain the floating   IP. Changing this creates a new floating IP.
    # "address" - The actual floating IP address itself.
    # "pool" - (Required) The name of the pool from which to obtain the floating   IP. Changing this creates a new floating IP.
    # "fixed_ip" - The fixed IP address corresponding to the floating IP.
    # "pool" - (Required) The name of the pool from which to obtain the floating   IP. Changing this creates a new floating IP.
    # "instance_id" - UUID of the compute instance associated with the floating IP.
    # "pool" - (Required) The name of the pool from which to obtain the floating   IP. Changing this creates a new floating IP.
}
opentelekomcloud-resource-compute-floati.description:
Manages a V2 floating IP resource within OpenTelekomCloud Nova (compute)
that can be used for compute instances.
These are similar to Neutron (networking) floating IP resources,
but only networking floating IPs can be used with load balancers.

opentelekomcloud-resource-compute-instan.body:
resource "opentelekomcloud_compute_instance_v2" "$1" {
    # contents - (Required) The contents of the file. Limited to 255 bytes.
    contents = ""

    # file - (Required) The absolute path of the destination file.
    file = ""

    # source_type - (Required) The source type of the device. Must be one of   "blank", "image", "volume", or "snapshot". Changing this creates a new   server.
    source_type = ""

    # name - (Required) A unique name for the resource.
    name = ""

    # region - (Optional) The region in which to create the server instance. If   omitted, the `region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this   creates a new server.
    region = ""

    # image_id - (Optional) (Optional; Required if `image_name` is empty and not booting   from a volume. Do not specify if booting from a volume.) The image ID of   the desired image for the server. Changing this creates a new server.
    image_id = ""

    # image_name - (Optional) (Optional; Required if `image_id` is empty and not booting   from a volume. Do not specify if booting from a volume.) The name of the   desired image for the server. Changing this creates a new server.
    image_name = ""

    # flavor_id - (Optional) (Optional; Required if `flavor_name` is empty) The flavor ID of   the desired flavor for the server. Changing this resizes the existing server.
    flavor_id = ""

    # flavor_name - (Optional) (Optional; Required if `flavor_id` is empty) The name of the   desired flavor for the server. Changing this resizes the existing server.
    flavor_name = ""

    # user_data - (Optional) The user data to provide when launching the instance.   Changing this creates a new server.
    user_data = ""

    # security_groups - (Optional) An array of one or more security group names   to associate with the server. Changing this creates a new server.
    security_groups = ""

    # availability_zone - (Optional) The availability zone in which to create   the server. Changing this creates a new server.
    availability_zone = ""

    # network - (Optional) An array of one or more networks to attach to the   instance. Required when there are multiple networks defined for the tenant.   The network object structure is documented below. Changing this creates a   new server.
    network = ""

    # metadata - (Optional) Metadata key/value pairs to make available from   within the instance. Changing this updates the existing server metadata.
    metadata = ""

    # config_drive - (Optional) Whether to use the config_drive feature to   configure the instance. Changing this creates a new server.
    config_drive = ""

    # admin_pass - (Optional) The administrative password to assign to the server.   Changing this changes the root password on the existing server.
    admin_pass = ""

    # key_pair - (Optional) The name of a key pair to put on the server. The key   pair must already be created and associated with the tenant's account.   Changing this creates a new server.
    key_pair = ""

    # block_device - (Optional) Configuration of block devices. The block_device   structure is documented below. Changing this creates a new server.   You can specify multiple block devices which will create an instance with   multiple disks. This configuration is very flexible, so please see the   following [reference](http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/block_device_mapping.html)   for more information.
    block_device = ""

    # scheduler_hints - (Optional) Provide the Nova scheduler with hints on how   the instance should be launched. The available hints are described below.
    scheduler_hints = ""

    # personality - (Optional) Customize the personality of an instance by   defining one or more files and their contents. The personality structure   is described below.
    personality = ""

    # tags - (Optional) The tags of the image. It must be a list of strings.
    tags = ""

    # tag - (Optional) Tags key/value pairs to associate with the instance.
    tag = ""

    # stop_before_destroy - (Optional) Whether to try stop instance gracefully   before destroying it, thus giving chance for guest OS daemons to stop correctly.   If instance doesn't stop within timeout, it will be destroyed anyway.
    stop_before_destroy = ""

    # force_delete - (Optional) Whether to force the OpenTelekomCloud instance to be   forcefully deleted. This is useful for environments that have reclaim / soft   deletion enabled.
    force_delete = ""

    # auto_recovery - (Optional) Configures or deletes automatic recovery of an instance
    auto_recovery = ""

    # uuid - (Optional) (Required unless `port`  or `name` is provided) The network UUID to   attach to the server. Changing this creates a new server.
    uuid = ""

    # name - (Optional) (Required unless `uuid` or `port` is provided) The human-readable   name of the network. Changing this creates a new server.
    name = ""

    # port - (Optional) (Required unless `uuid` or `name` is provided) The port UUID of a   network to attach to the server. Changing this creates a new server.
    port = ""

    # access_network - (Optional) Specifies if this network should be used for   provisioning access. Accepts true or false. Defaults to false.
    access_network = ""

    # uuid - (Optional) (Required unless `source_type` is set to `"blank"` ) The UUID of   the image, volume, or snapshot. Changing this creates a new server.
    uuid = ""

    # volume_size - (Optional) The size of the volume to create (in gigabytes). Required   in the following combinations: source=image and destination=volume,   and source=blank and destination=volume. Changing this creates a new server.
    volume_size = ""

    # volume_type - (Optional) Currently, the value can be `SSD` (ultra-I/O disk type), `SAS` (high I/O disk type), or `SATA` (common I/O disk type)   [OTC-API](https://docs.otc.t-systems.com/en-us/api/ecs/en-us_topic_0065817708.html)
    volume_type = ""

    # boot_index - (Optional) The boot index of the volume. It defaults to 0.   Changing this creates a new server.
    boot_index = ""

    # destination_type - (Optional) The type that gets created. Currently only   support "volume". Changing this creates a new server.
    destination_type = ""

    # delete_on_termination - (Optional) Delete the volume / block device upon   termination of the instance. Defaults to false. Changing this creates a   new server.
    delete_on_termination = ""

    # group - (Optional) A UUID of a Server Group. The instance will be placed   into that group.
    group = ""

    # different_host - (Optional) A list of instance UUIDs. The instance will   be scheduled on a different host than all other instances.
    different_host = ""

    # same_host - (Optional) A list of instance UUIDs. The instance will be   scheduled on the same host of those specified.
    same_host = ""

    # query - (Optional) A conditional query that a compute node must pass in   order to host an instance.
    query = ""

    # target_cell - (Optional) The name of a cell to host the instance.
    target_cell = ""

    # tenancy - (Optional) The tenancy specifies whether the ECS is to be created on a Dedicated Host  (DeH) or in a shared pool.
    tenancy = ""

    # deh_id - (Optional) The ID of DeH. This parameter takes effect only when the value  of tenancy is dedicated.
    deh_id = ""

    # deh_id - (Optional) The ID of DeH. This parameter takes effect only when the value  of tenancy is dedicated.
    deh_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "region" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "contents" - (Required) The contents of the file. Limited to 255 bytes.
    # "name" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "contents" - (Required) The contents of the file. Limited to 255 bytes.
    # "access_ip_v4" - The first detected Fixed IPv4 address _or_ the
    # "contents" - (Required) The contents of the file. Limited to 255 bytes.
    # "access_ip_v6" - The first detected Fixed IPv6 address.
    # "contents" - (Required) The contents of the file. Limited to 255 bytes.
    # "metadata" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "contents" - (Required) The contents of the file. Limited to 255 bytes.
    # "security_groups" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "contents" - (Required) The contents of the file. Limited to 255 bytes.
    # "flavor_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "contents" - (Required) The contents of the file. Limited to 255 bytes.
    # "flavor_name" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "contents" - (Required) The contents of the file. Limited to 255 bytes.
    # "network/uuid" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "contents" - (Required) The contents of the file. Limited to 255 bytes.
    # "network/name" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "contents" - (Required) The contents of the file. Limited to 255 bytes.
    # "network/port" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "contents" - (Required) The contents of the file. Limited to 255 bytes.
    # "network/fixed_ip_v4" - The Fixed IPv4 address of the Instance on that
    # "contents" - (Required) The contents of the file. Limited to 255 bytes.
    # "network/fixed_ip_v6" - The Fixed IPv6 address of the Instance on that
    # "contents" - (Required) The contents of the file. Limited to 255 bytes.
    # "network/mac" - The MAC address of the NIC on that network.
    # "contents" - (Required) The contents of the file. Limited to 255 bytes.
    # "all_metadata" - Contains all instance metadata, even metadata not set
    # "contents" - (Required) The contents of the file. Limited to 255 bytes.
    # "auto_recovery" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "contents" - (Required) The contents of the file. Limited to 255 bytes.
}

opentelekomcloud-resource-compute-secgro.body:
resource "opentelekomcloud_compute_secgroup_v2" "$1" {
    # ip_protocol - (Required) The protocol type that will be allowed. Changing this creates a new security group rule.
    ip_protocol = ""

    # to_port - (Required) An integer representing the upper bound of the port range to open. Changing this creates a new security group rule.
    to_port = ""

    # from_port - (Required) An integer representing the lower bound of the port range to open. Changing this creates a new security group rule.
    from_port = ""

    # description - (Required) A description for the security group. Changing this   updates the `description` of an existing security group.
    description = ""

    # name - (Required) A unique name for the security group. Changing this   updates the `name` of an existing security group.
    name = ""

    # region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Compute client.   A Compute client is needed to create a security group. If omitted, the   `region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new   security group.
    region = ""

    # rule - (Optional) A rule describing how the security group operates. The   rule object structure is documented below. Changing this updates the   security group rules. As shown in the example above, multiple rule blocks   may be used.
    rule = ""

    # cidr - (Optional) Required if `from_group_id` or `self` is empty. The IP range that will be the source of network traffic to the security group. Use 0.0.0.0/0 to allow all IP addresses. Changing this creates a new security group rule. Cannot be combined with `from_group_id` or `self`.
    cidr = ""

    # from_group_id - (Optional) Required if `cidr` or `self` is empty. The ID of a group from which to forward traffic to the parent group. Changing this creates a new security group rule. Cannot be combined with `cidr` or `self`.
    from_group_id = ""

    # self - (Optional) Required if `cidr` and `from_group_id` is empty. If true, the security group itself will be added as a source to this ingress rule. Cannot be combined with `cidr` or `from_group_id`.
    self = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "region" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "self" - (Optional) Required if "cidr" and "from_group_id" is empty. If true, the security group itself will be added as a source to this ingress rule. Cannot be combined with "cidr" or "from_group_id".
    # "name" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "self" - (Optional) Required if "cidr" and "from_group_id" is empty. If true, the security group itself will be added as a source to this ingress rule. Cannot be combined with "cidr" or "from_group_id".
    # "description" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "self" - (Optional) Required if "cidr" and "from_group_id" is empty. If true, the security group itself will be added as a source to this ingress rule. Cannot be combined with "cidr" or "from_group_id".
    # "rule" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "self" - (Optional) Required if "cidr" and "from_group_id" is empty. If true, the security group itself will be added as a source to this ingress rule. Cannot be combined with "cidr" or "from_group_id".
}

    vpc_id = ""

For a DCS Redis or Memcached instance in single-node or master/standby mode, the cache   capacity can be 2 GB, 4 GB, 8 GB, 16 GB, 32 GB, or 64 GB.   For a DCS Redis instance in cluster mode, the cache capacity can be 64, 128, 256, 512,   or 1024 GB.
    capacity = ""

    # name - (Required) Indicates the name of an instance. An instance name starts with a letter, 	consists of 4 to 64 characters, and supports only letters, digits, and hyphens (-).
    name = ""

    engine_version = ""

    partition_num = ""

    # access_user - (Optional) Username used for accessing a DCS instance after password   authentication. A username starts with a letter, consists of 1 to 64 characters,   and supports only letters, digits, and hyphens (-).
    access_user = ""

    # password - (Optional) Password of a DCS instance.   The password of a DCS Redis instance must meet the following complexity requirements:
    password = ""

    # maintain_begin - (Optional) Indicates the time at which a maintenance time window starts.   Format: HH:mm:ss.   The start time and end time of a maintenance time window must indicate the time segment of 	a supported maintenance time window. For details, see section Querying Maintenance Time Windows.   The start time must be set to 22:00, 02:00, 06:00, 10:00, 14:00, or 18:00.   Parameters maintain_begin and maintain_end must be set in pairs. If parameter maintain_begin 	is left blank, parameter maintain_end is also blank. In this case, the system automatically 	allocates the default start time 02:00.
    maintain_begin = ""

    # maintain_end - (Optional) Indicates the time at which a maintenance time window ends.   Format: HH:mm:ss.   The start time and end time of a maintenance time window must indicate the time segment of 	a supported maintenance time window. For details, see section Querying Maintenance Time Windows.   The end time is four hours later than the start time. For example, if the start time is 22:00, 	the end time is 02:00.   Parameters maintain_begin and maintain_end must be set in pairs. If parameter maintain_end is left 	blank, parameter maintain_begin is also blank. In this case, the system automatically allocates 	the default end time 06:00.
    maintain_end = ""

    # save_days - (Optional) Retention time. Unit: day. Range: 1–7.
    save_days = ""

    # backup_type - (Optional) Backup type. Options:   auto: automatic backup.   manual: manual backup.
    backup_type = ""

    # begin_at - (Optional) Time at which backup starts. "00:00-01:00" indicates that backup   starts at 00:00:00.
    begin_at = ""

    # period_type - (Optional) Interval at which backup is performed. Currently, only weekly   backup is supported.
    period_type = ""

    # backup_at - (Optional) Day in a week on which backup starts. Range: 1–7. Where: 1   indicates Monday; 7 indicates Sunday.
    backup_at = ""

    # "vpc_id" - See Argument Reference above.

    # "available_zones" - See Argument Reference above.

When a message fails to be consumed after the number of consumption attempts of   this message reaches this value, DMS stores this message into the dead letter queue.     # "max_consume_count" - (Optional) This parameter is mandatory only when redrive_policy is   set to enable. This parameter indicates the maximum number of allowed message consumption   failures. When a message fails to be consumed after the number of consumption attempts of   this message reaches this value, DMS stores this message into the dead letter queue.   The max_consume_count value range is 1–100.
    # "produced_messages" - Indicates the total number of messages (not including the messages that have expired and been deleted) in a queue.
    # "max_consume_count" - (Optional) This parameter is mandatory only when redrive_policy is   set to enable. This parameter indicates the maximum number of allowed message consumption   failures. When a message fails to be consumed after the number of consumption attempts of   this message reaches this value, DMS stores this message into the dead letter queue.   The max_consume_count value range is 1–100.
    # "group_count" - Indicates the total number of consumer groups in a queue.
    # "max_consume_count" - (Optional) This parameter is mandatory only when redrive_policy is   set to enable. This parameter indicates the maximum number of allowed message consumption   failures. When a message fails to be consumed after the number of consumption attempts of   this message reaches this value, DMS stores this message into the dead letter queue.   The max_consume_count value range is 1–100.
}

opentelekomcloud-resource-elb-health.body:
resource "opentelekomcloud_elb_health" "$1" {
    # listener_id - (Required) Specifies the ID of the listener to which the health   check task belongs. Changing this creates a new elb health.
    listener_id = ""

    # region - (Optional) The region in which to create the elb health. If   omitted, the `region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this   creates a new elb health.
    region = ""

    # healthcheck_protocol - (Optional) Specifies the protocol used for the health   check. The value can be HTTP or TCP (case-insensitive).
    healthcheck_protocol = ""

    # healthcheck_uri - (Optional) Specifies the URI for health check. This parameter   is valid when healthcheck_ protocol is HTTP. The value is a string of 1 to 80   characters that must start with a slash (/) and can only contain letters, digits,   and special characters, such as -/.%?#&.
    healthcheck_uri = ""

    # healthcheck_connect_port - (Optional) Specifies the port used for the health   check. The value ranges from 1 to 65535.
    healthcheck_connect_port = ""

    # healthy_threshold - (Optional) Specifies the threshold at which the health   check result is success, that is, the number of consecutive successful health   checks when the health check result of the backend server changes from fail   to success. The value ranges from 1 to 10.
    healthy_threshold = ""

    # unhealthy_threshold - (Optional) Specifies the threshold at which the health   check result is fail, that is, the number of consecutive failed health checks   when the health check result of the backend server changes from success to fail.   The value ranges from 1 to 10.
    unhealthy_threshold = ""

    # healthcheck_timeout - (Optional) Specifies the maximum timeout duration   (s) for the health check. The value ranges from 1 to 50.
    healthcheck_timeout = ""

    # healthcheck_interval - (Optional) Specifies the maximum interval (s) for   health check. The value ranges from 1 to 5.
    healthcheck_interval = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "region" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "healthcheck_interval" - (Optional) Specifies the maximum interval (s) for   health check. The value ranges from 1 to 5.
    # "listener_id" - See Argument Reference above.

opentelekomcloud-resource-elb-listener.body:
resource "opentelekomcloud_elb_listener" "$1" {
    # lb_algorithm - (Required) Specifies the load balancing algorithm for the   listener. The value can be roundrobin, leastconn, or source.
    lb_algorithm = ""

    # backend_port - (Required) Specifies the backend port. The value ranges from   1 to 65535.
    backend_port = ""

    # backend_protocol - (Required) Specifies the backend protocol. If the value   of protocol is UDP, the value of this parameter can only be UDP. The value can   be HTTP, TCP, or UDP.  Changing this creates a new elb listener.
    backend_protocol = ""

    # protocol_port - (Required) Specifies the listening port. The value ranges from 1   to 65535.
    protocol_port = ""

    # protocol - (Required) Specifies the listening protocol used for layer 4   or 7. The value can be HTTP, TCP, HTTPS, or UDP.  Changing this creates a   new elb listener.
    protocol = ""

    # loadbalancer_id - (Required) Specifies the ID of the load balancer to which   the listener belongs.  Changing this creates a new elb listener.
    loadbalancer_id = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the load balancer name. The name is a string   of 1 to 64 characters that consist of letters, digits, underscores (_), and   hyphens (-).
    name = ""

    # region - (Optional) The region in which to create the elb listener. If   omitted, the `region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this   creates a new elb listener.
    region = ""

    # description - (Optional) Provides supplementary information about the listener.   The value is a string of 0 to 128 characters and cannot be <>.
    description = ""

    # session_sticky - (Optional) Specifies whether to enable sticky session.   The value can be true or false. The Sticky session is enabled when the value   is true, and is disabled when the value is false. If the value of protocol is   HTTP, HTTPS, or TCP, and the value of lb_algorithm is not roundrobin, the value   of this parameter can only be false.  Changing this creates a new elb listener.
    session_sticky = ""

    # sticky_session_type - (Optional) Specifies the cookie processing method.   The value is insert. insert indicates that the cookie is inserted by the load   balancer. This parameter is valid when protocol is set to HTTP, and session_sticky   to true. The default value is insert. This parameter is invalid when protocol   is set to TCP or UDP, which means the parameter is empty.  Changing this creates   a new elb listener.
    sticky_session_type = ""

    # cookie_timeout - (Optional) Specifies the cookie timeout period (minutes).   This parameter is valid when protocol is set to HTTP, session_sticky to true,   and sticky_session_type to insert. This parameter is invalid when protocol is   set to TCP or UDP. The value ranges from 1 to 1440.  Changing this creates a   new elb listener.
    cookie_timeout = ""

    # tcp_timeout - (Optional) Specifies the TCP timeout period (minutes). This   parameter is valid when protocol is set to TCP. The value ranges from 1 to 5.
    tcp_timeout = ""

    # tcp_draining - (Optional) Specifies whether to maintain the TCP connection   to the backend ECS after the ECS is deleted. This parameter is valid when protocol   is set to TCP. The value can be true or false.
    tcp_draining = ""

    # tcp_draining_timeout - (Optional) Specifies the timeout duration (minutes)   for the TCP connection to the backend ECS after the ECS is deleted. This parameter   is valid when protocol is set to TCP, and tcp_draining to true. The value ranges   from 0 to 60.
    tcp_draining_timeout = ""

    # certificate_id - (Optional) Specifies the ID of the SSL certificate used   for security authentication when HTTPS is used to make API calls. This parameter   is mandatory if the value of protocol is HTTPS. The value can be obtained by   viewing the details of the SSL certificate.  Changing this creates a new elb   listener.
    certificate_id = ""

    # udp_timeout - (Optional) Specifies the UDP timeout duration (minutes). This   parameter is valid when protocol is set to UDP. The value ranges from 1 to 1440.
    udp_timeout = ""

    # ssl_protocols - (Optional) Specifies the SSL protocol standard supported   by a tracker, which is used for enabling specified encryption protocols. This   parameter is valid only when the value of protocol is set to HTTPS. The value   is TLSv1.2 or TLSv1.2 TLSv1.1 TLSv1. The default value is TLSv1.2. Changing   this creates a new elb listener.
    ssl_protocols = ""

    # ssl_ciphers - (Optional) Specifies the cipher suite of an encryption protocol.   This parameter is valid only when the value of protocol is set to HTTPS. The   value is Default, Extended, or Strict. The default value is Default. The value   can only be set to Extended if the value of ssl_protocols is set to TLSv1.2   TLSv1.1 TLSv1.
    ssl_ciphers = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "region" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "ssl_ciphers" - (Optional) Specifies the cipher suite of an encryption protocol.   This parameter is valid only when the value of protocol is set to HTTPS. The   value is Default, Extended, or Strict. The default value is Default. The value   can only be set to Extended if the value of ssl_protocols is set to TLSv1.2   TLSv1.1 TLSv1.
    # "name" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "ssl_ciphers" - (Optional) Specifies the cipher suite of an encryption protocol.   This parameter is valid only when the value of protocol is set to HTTPS. The   value is Default, Extended, or Strict. The default value is Default. The value   can only be set to Extended if the value of ssl_protocols is set to TLSv1.2   TLSv1.1 TLSv1.
    # "description" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "ssl_ciphers" - (Optional) Specifies the cipher suite of an encryption protocol.   This parameter is valid only when the value of protocol is set to HTTPS. The   value is Default, Extended, or Strict. The default value is Default. The value   can only be set to Extended if the value of ssl_protocols is set to TLSv1.2   TLSv1.1 TLSv1.
    # "loadbalancer_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "ssl_ciphers" - (Optional) Specifies the cipher suite of an encryption protocol.   This parameter is valid only when the value of protocol is set to HTTPS. The   value is Default, Extended, or Strict. The default value is Default. The value   can only be set to Extended if the value of ssl_protocols is set to TLSv1.2   TLSv1.1 TLSv1.
    # "protocol" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "ssl_ciphers" - (Optional) Specifies the cipher suite of an encryption protocol.   This parameter is valid only when the value of protocol is set to HTTPS. The   value is Default, Extended, or Strict. The default value is Default. The value   can only be set to Extended if the value of ssl_protocols is set to TLSv1.2   TLSv1.1 TLSv1.

opentelekomcloud-resource-elb-loadbalanc.body:
resource "opentelekomcloud_elb_loadbalancer" "$1" {
    # admin_state_up - (Required) Specifies the status of the load balancer.   Value range: 0 or false: indicates that the load balancer is stopped. Only   tenants are allowed to enter these two values. 1 or true: indicates that   the load balancer is running properly. 2 or false: indicates that the load   balancer is frozen. Only tenants are allowed to enter these two values.
    admin_state_up = ""

    # type - (Required) Specifies the load balancer type. The value can be   Internal or External. Changing this creates a new elb loadbalancer.
    type = ""

    # vpc_id - (Required) Specifies the VPC ID. Changing this creates a new   elb loadbalancer.
    vpc_id = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the load balancer name. The name is a string   of 1 to 64 characters that consist of letters, digits, underscores (_),   and hyphens (-).
    name = ""

    # region - (Optional) The region in which to create the loadbalancer. If   omitted, the `region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this   creates a new loadbalancer.
    region = ""

    # description - (Optional) Provides supplementary information about the   listener. The value is a string of 0 to 128 characters and cannot be <>.
    description = ""

    # bandwidth - (Optional) Specifies the bandwidth (Mbit/s). This parameter   is mandatory when type is set to External, and it is invalid when type   is set to Internal. The value ranges from 1 to 300.
    bandwidth = ""

    # vip_subnet_id - (Optional) Specifies the ID of the private network   to be added. This parameter is mandatory when type is set to Internal,   and it is invalid when type is set to External. Changing this creates a   new elb loadbalancer.
    vip_subnet_id = ""

    # az - (Optional) Specifies the ID of the availability zone (AZ). This   parameter is mandatory when type is set to Internal, and it is invalid   when type is set to External. Changing this creates a new elb   loadbalancer.
    az = ""

    # security_group_id - (Optional) Specifies the security group ID. The   value is a string of 1 to 200 characters that consists of uppercase and   lowercase letters, digits, and hyphens (-). This parameter is mandatory   only when type is set to Internal. Changing this creates a new elb   loadbalancer.
    security_group_id = ""

    # vip_address - (Optional) Specifies the IP address provided by ELB.   When type is set to External, the value of this parameter is the elastic   IP address. When type is set to Internal, the value of this parameter is   the private network IP address. You can select an existing elastic IP address   and create a public network load balancer. When this parameter is configured,   parameter bandwidth is invalid. Changing this creates a new elb loadbalancer.
    vip_address = ""

resource "opentelekomcloud_lb_loadbalancer_v2" "$1" {
    # vip_subnet_id - (Required) The network on which to allocate the   Loadbalancer's address. A tenant can only create Loadbalancers on networks   authorized by policy (e.g. networks that belong to them or networks that   are shared).  Changing this creates a new loadbalancer.
    vip_subnet_id = ""

    # region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client.   A Networking client is needed to create an LB member. If omitted, the   `region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new   LB member.
    region = ""

    # name - (Optional) Human-readable name for the Loadbalancer. Does not have   to be unique.
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) Human-readable description for the Loadbalancer.
    description = ""

    # tenant_id - (Optional) Required for admins. The UUID of the tenant who owns   the Loadbalancer.  Only administrative users can specify a tenant UUID   other than their own.  Changing this creates a new loadbalancer.
    tenant_id = ""

    # vip_address - (Optional) The ip address of the load balancer.   Changing this creates a new loadbalancer.
    vip_address = ""

    # admin_state_up - (Optional) The administrative state of the Loadbalancer.   A valid value is true (UP) or false (DOWN).
    admin_state_up = ""

    # flavor - (Optional) The UUID of a flavor. Changing this creates a new   loadbalancer.
    flavor = ""

    # loadbalancer_provider - (Optional) The name of the provider. Changing this creates a new loadbalancer.
    loadbalancer_provider = ""

    # security_group_ids - (Optional) A list of security group IDs to apply to the   loadbalancer. The security groups must be specified by ID and not name (as   opposed to how they are configured with the Compute Instance).
    security_group_ids = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "region" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "security_group_ids" - (Optional) A list of security group IDs to apply to the   loadbalancer. The security groups must be specified by ID and not name (as   opposed to how they are configured with the Compute Instance).
    # "vip_subnet_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "security_group_ids" - (Optional) A list of security group IDs to apply to the   loadbalancer. The security groups must be specified by ID and not name (as   opposed to how they are configured with the Compute Instance).
    # "name" - See Argument Reference above.

resource "opentelekomcloud_lb_monitor_v2" "$1" {
    # max_retries - (Required) Number of permissible ping failures before   changing the member's status to INACTIVE. Must be a number between 1   and 10..
    max_retries = ""

    timeout = ""

    # delay - (Required) The time, in seconds, between sending probes to members.
    delay = ""

    # type - (Required) The type of probe, which is PING, TCP, HTTP, or HTTPS,   that is sent by the load balancer to verify the member state. Changing this   creates a new monitor.
    type = ""

    # pool_id - (Required) The id of the pool that this monitor will be assigned to.
    pool_id = ""

    # region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client.
    region = ""

    # name - (Optional) The Name of the Monitor.
    name = ""

    # tenant_id - (Optional) Required for admins. The UUID of the tenant who owns   the monitor.  Only administrative users can specify a tenant UUID   other than their own. Changing this creates a new monitor.
    tenant_id = ""

    # url_path - (Optional) Required for HTTP(S) types. URI path that will be   accessed if monitor type is HTTP or HTTPS.
    url_path = ""

    # http_method - (Optional) Required for HTTP(S) types. The HTTP method used  for requests by the monitor. If this attribute is not specified, it  defaults to "GET".
    http_method = ""

    # expected_codes - (Optional) Required for HTTP(S) types. Expected HTTP codes   for a passing HTTP(S) monitor. You can either specify a single status like   "200", or a range like "200-202".

    protocol = ""

    tenant_id = ""

    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) Human-readable description for the pool.

    # loadbalancer_id - (Optional) The load balancer on which to provision this   pool. Changing this creates a new pool.   Note:  One of LoadbalancerID or ListenerID must be provided.

    # listener_id - (Optional) The Listener on which the members of the pool   will be associated with. Changing this creates a new pool. 	Note:  One of LoadbalancerID or ListenerID must be provided.

    # "protocol" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "cookie_name" - (Optional) The name of the cookie if persistence mode is set   appropriately. Required if "type = APP_COOKIE".
    # "lb_method" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "cookie_name" - (Optional) The name of the cookie if persistence mode is set   appropriately. Required if "type = APP_COOKIE".
    # "persistence" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "cookie_name" - (Optional) The name of the cookie if persistence mode is set   appropriately. Required if "type = APP_COOKIE".
    # "admin_state_up" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "cookie_name" - (Optional) The name of the cookie if persistence mode is set   appropriately. Required if "type = APP_COOKIE".
}
